intro: Cnestis lescrauwaetii, commonly known as the Lescauwaet's cnestis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
